headline: Behind Berkshire’s Curtain: Is Greg Abel Preparing to Cut Davita Loose?
summary: Davita hit its 23rd new 52-week low on Tuesday. Its stock is now within a few dollars of trading in double digits. That’s not a good thing, given that its share price was nearly $180 a year ago.

headline: Coca-Cola taps first-ever chief digital officer
summary: The beverage maker picked Sedef Salingan Sahin to serve in the newly created CDO role citing a pressing need to accelerate tech adoption.

headline: Sector Update: Consumer Stocks Mixed Pre-Bell Wednesday
summary: Consumer stocks were mixed pre-bell Wednesday, with the State Street Consumer Staples Select Sector

headline: Coca-Cola abandons Costa Coffee sale
summary: Coca-Cola has abandoned plans to sell Costa Coffee after a string of bidders failed to meet the £2bn price tag.

headline: BofA downgrades Coca-Cola bottler as muted top-line caps valuation upside
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America (BofA) has downgraded Coca-Cola European Partners (LON:CCEPC) (NASDAQ:CCEP) to Neutral, arguing that muted top-line growth is limiting valuation upside despite solid earnings momentum.

headline: The Coca-Cola Company Announces Changes in Operational Leadership and Creation of New Enterprise Role to Accelerate Digital Transformation
summary: ATLANTA, January 14, 2026--The Coca-Cola Company today announced a series of leadership changes designed to bring the business closer to consumers and enable faster technology adoption across the enterprise, unlocking future growth.

headline: Coca Cola Halts Costa Coffee Sale After Offers Fall Short
summary: Company ends auction process as bids from private equity firms miss valuation expectations.

headline: Wall Street Lunch: Gold, Silver Hit All-Time Highs As Safe-Haven Demand Surges
summary: Gold (XAUUSD:CUR) and silver (XAGUSD:CUR) hit fresh all-time highs, with gold up about 1% above $4,641/oz and silver jumping 6% to top $90/oz for the first time.

headline: Coca-Cola ‘jettisons Costa Coffee sale plan’
summary: The US giant has reportedly held talks in recent months to offload the UK-based chain – and is now said to have abandoned the idea.

headline: PRESS: Coca-Cola ends effort to sell Costa as offers fall short — FT
Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Saks Global's Luxury Gamble Fails
summary: Saks Global files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, secures $1.75B financing. Coca-Cola axes Costa Coffee sale over lower bids. Musk says Tesla FSD only available as subscription after Feb. 14.
